lines.gurmukhi: 1 gurmuK l`Cx
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: pihlw gurmuiK jnmu lY BY ivic vrqY hoie ieAwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Pahilaa Guramoukhi Janamu Lai Bhai Vichi Varatai Hoi Iaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having been born in this world, the gurmukh becoming innocent and ignorant ducts himself in the fear of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK lY gurisKu hoie Bwie Bgiq ivic Krw isAwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Lai Gurasikhu Hoi Bhaai Bhagati Vichi Kharaa Siaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Adopting the teaching of the Guru becomes the Sikh of the Guru and sustaining himself in the loving devotion, e leads a pure and intelligent life.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK suix mMnY smiJ mwx mhiq ivic rhY inmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Souni Mannai Samajhi Maani Mahati Vichi Rahai Nimaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: After listening to and understanding it, e accepts the teachings of the Guru and even earning the glories continues be humble.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK gurisKu pUjdw pYrI pY rihrws luBwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Gurasikhu Poojadaa Pairee Pai Raharaasi Loubhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In accordance with the teachings of the Guru, he worships the e Sikhs and touching their feet and, following their virtus path, he becomes avourite of all.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK mnhu n ivsrY clxu jwix jugiq imhmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Manahu N Visarai Chalanu Jaani Jougati Mihamaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru's instruction is never forgotten by the Sikh and he having learnt the way of considering himself as a passing guest, spends his life (purposefully) here.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK imTw bolxw iniv clxw gurisKu prvwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Mitdaa Bolanaa Nivi Chalanaa Gurasikhu Paravaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh of the Guru speaks sweetly and accept  humility as the proper way of life.

lines.gurmukhi: Gwil Kwie gurisK imil Kwxw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Ghaali Khaai Gurasikh Mili Khaanaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukh, guru-oriented person earns is livelihood by hard labour and shares his victuals with other Sikhs of the um.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 gurmuK-qwx inqwxw

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh strong yet humble-

lines.gurmukhi: idsit drs ilv swvDwnu sbd suriq cyqMnu isAwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Disati Daras Liv Saavadhaanu Sabad Surati Chaytannu Siaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The vision of a gurmukh remains seated in his desire for the glimpse of the Lord, and by virtue of his watchful realization of the sabad, he acquires wisdom.

lines.gurmukhi: nwmu dwnu iesnwnu idVu mn bc krm krY mylwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Dirhu Man Bach Karam Karai Maylaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being steadfast in meditation upon mint, charity, and ablution, he maintains co-ordination in his mind, speech and actions.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK QoVw bolxw QoVw sauxw QoVw Kwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Dorhaa Bolanaa Dorhaa Saounaa Dorhaa Khaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh of the Guru speaks less, sleeps less and eats little.

lines.gurmukhi: pr qn pr Dn prhrY pr inMdw suix min srmwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Par Tan Par Dhan Paraharai Par Nidaa Souni Mani Saramaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Repudiating other's body (woman) and other's wealth he avoids listening to the slander of others.

lines.gurmukhi: gur mUriq gur sbdu hY swDsMgiq smsir prvwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Moorati Satigur Sabadu Saadhasangati Samasari Paravaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He accepts the presence of Guru equally in the sabad (Word) and the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: iek min ieku ArwDxw duqIAw nwsiq BwvY Bwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Mani Iku Araadhanaa Douteeaa Naasati Bhaavai Bhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: With single-mindedness he adores the one Lord, and having no sense of duality, he rejoices in the will of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK hodY qwx inqwxw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Hodai Taani Nitaanaa ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Despite his all powers the gurmukh considers himself meek and humble .

lines.gurmukhi: 3 mnmuK, gurmuK qoN ivrvw, mnmuK mUrK hIxw qy iek`lw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The self-willed one is a fool, deprived and alone,   ,

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK rMgu n idseI hoNdI AKIN AMnHw soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Rangu N Disaee Hondee Akheen Annhaa Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who cannot see the grandneur of gurmukhs is blind despite his eyes.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK smiJ n skeI hoNdI kMnIN bolw hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Samajhi N Sakaee Hondee Kanneen Bolaa Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He â€˜who does not understand the idea of a gurmukh is deaf despite his ears.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK sbdu n gwveI hoNdI jIBY guMgw goeI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sabadu N Gaavaee Hondee Jeebhai Goungaa Goee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He ho does not sing the hymns of Gurmukh is dumb though having a tongue.

lines.gurmukhi: crn kvl dI vwsu ivxu nktw hoNdy nik AloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Dee Vaas Vinu Nakataa Honday Naki Aloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Devoid of the fragrance of the lotus feet of the Guru, he is supposed to be with a clipped nose (brazen-faced) despite his lovely nose.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK kwr ivhUixAw hoNdI krI luMjw duK roeI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Kaar Vihooniaan Hondee Kareen Lounjaa Doukh Roee.

Shabad OS B.translation: A person devoid of Gurmukh's sense of service is a wailing cripple, his healthy hands notwithstanding and he goes on weeping.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq iciq n vseI so miq hIxu n lhNdw FoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Chiti N Vasaee So Mati Heenu Lahadaa Ddhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: One in whose heart, the wisdom of the Guru is not sustained, is a fool who gets no shelter anywhere.

lines.gurmukhi: mUrK nwil n koie sQoeI ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakh Naali N Koi Sadoee ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: The idiot has no companion.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 mUrK, Gu`GU diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Fool compared to owl,

lines.gurmukhi: Gu`GU suJ n suJeI vsdI Cif rhY EjwVI
lines.transliteration_english: Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhaee Vasadee Chhadi Rahai Aojaarhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Owl does not have any thoughtful understanding and leaving habitats lives in deserted places.

lines.gurmukhi: ieil pVHweI nw pVHY cUhy Kwie aufy dyhwVI
lines.transliteration_english: Ili Parhhaaee N Parhhai Choohay Khaai Uday Dayhaarhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Kite cannot be taught texts and eating rats keeps on flying the whole day.

lines.gurmukhi: vwsu n AwvY vwNs no haumY Aig n cMdx vwVI
lines.transliteration_english: Vaasu N Aavai Vaans No Haoumai Angi N Channan Vaarhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even being in the garden of sandal wood, the egotist bamboo does not get fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: sMK smuMdhu sKxw gurmiq hIxw dyh ivgwVI
lines.transliteration_english: Sankhu Samoundahu Sakhanaa Guramati Heenaa Dayh Vigaarhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the conch remains empty though liviing in sea, the person devoid of the wisdom of Guru (gurmati) is spoiling his body.

lines.gurmukhi: isMmlu ibrKu n sPlu hoie Awp gxwey vfw AnwVI
lines.transliteration_english: Sinmalu Birakhu N Saphalu Hoi Aapu Ganaaay Vadaa Anaarhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cotton-silk tree does not bear fruit howsoever much that colourless may brag of its greatness.

lines.gurmukhi: mUrKu PkiV pvY irhwVI ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakhu Dhakarhi Pavai Rihaarhee ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only fools quarrls over trivialities.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 mUrK AMnHy dI AwrsI

Shabad OS B.translation: Mirror before a blind fool

lines.gurmukhi: AMnHy Agy AwrsI nweI Dir n vDweI pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Annhay Agai Aarasee Naaee Dhari N Vadhaaee Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A barber showing mirror to a blind person never gets the reward.

lines.gurmukhi: boly Agy gwvIAY sUMm n fUm kvwie pYnHwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bolai Agai Gaaveeai Soomu N Doomu Kavaai Painhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Singing before a deaf person is in vain and likewise a miser does not present a robe to his minstrel as a gift.

lines.gurmukhi: puCY msliq guMigAhu ivgVY kMmu jvwbu n AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Pouchhai Masalati Goungiahu Vigarhai Kanmu Javaabu N Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the dumb is consulted on any issue, the issue will go worse and he will not be able to answer.

lines.gurmukhi: PulvwVI viV guxguxw mwlI no n ienwmu idvwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Phulavaarhee Varhi Gounagounaa Maalee No N Inaamu Divaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a person devoid of the sense of smell goes to a garden, he cannot recommend the gardener for award.

lines.gurmukhi: lUly nwil ivAwhIAY ikv gil imil kwmix gil lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Loolay Naali Viaaheeai Kiv Gali Mili Kaamani Gali Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: How could a woman married to a cripple embrace him.

lines.gurmukhi: sBnw cwl suhwvxI lMgVw kry lKwau lMgwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhanaa Chaal Suhaavanee Lagarhaa Karay Lakhaau Lagaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Where all others have a fair gait, the lame however he may pretend, would definitely be seen limping.

lines.gurmukhi: lukY n mUrKu Awpu lKwvY ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Loukai N Moorakhu Aapu Lakhaavai ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus, the fool never remains hidden, and he definitely exposes himself.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 mUrK dw sOrnw

Shabad OS B.translation: Reclamation of a fool

lines.gurmukhi: pQru mUil n iBjeI sau vriHAwN jil AMdir vsY
lines.transliteration_english: Padaru Mooli N Bhijaee Sau Varhiaa Jali Andari Vasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even after remaining in water for a hundred years the stone would not get wet at all.

lines.gurmukhi: pQr Kyq n jMmeI cwir mhIny ieMdr vrsY
lines.transliteration_english: Padar Khaytu N Janmaee Chaari Maheenay Indaru Varasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: It may rain for four months continuously, but a stone would not sprout in the field.

lines.gurmukhi: pQir cMnxu rgVIey cMnx vwNig n pQru GsY
lines.transliteration_english: Padari Channanu Ragarheeay Channan Vaangi N Padaru Ghasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A stone grinding sandal, never gets worn off like sandal.

lines.gurmukhi: isl vty inq pIsdy rs ks jwxY vwsu n rsY
lines.transliteration_english: Sil Vatay Nit Peesaday Ras Kas Jaanay Vaasu N Rasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Grinding stones always grind the material but never know about the taste and virtues of the things ground.

lines.gurmukhi: ckI iPrY shMsvwr Kwie n pIAY BuK n qsY
lines.transliteration_english: Chakee Dhirai Sahans Vaar Khaai N Peeai Bhoukh N Tasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The grinding stone moves around thousands of times but it never feels hunger or thirst.

lines.gurmukhi: pQr GVY vrqxw hyiT auqy hoie GVw ivxsY
lines.transliteration_english: Padar Gharhai Varatanaa Haytdi Outay Hoi Gharhaa Vinasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The relationship between the stone and the pitcher is such that pitcher has to perish whether the stone strikes the pitcher or vice versa.

lines.gurmukhi: mUrK suriq n js ApjsY ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakh Surati N Jas Apajasai ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: The stupid does not understand the difference between fame and infamy.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 mUrK p`Qr hY sMg ivc kusMgI rihMdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The fool is a stone; he remains adamant in any company

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs pQr sMgu hY pwrs pris n kMcnu hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Paaras Padar Sangu Hai Paaras Parasi N Kanchanu Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ordinary stone may be in contact with the philosopher's stone but it does not get transformed into gold.

lines.gurmukhi: hIry mwxku pQrhu pQr koie n hwir provY
lines.transliteration_english: Heeray Maanak Padarahu Padar Koi N Haari Parovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Diamonds and rubies are extracted from the stones but the latter cannot be stringed as a necklace.

lines.gurmukhi: vit jvwhru qolIAY muil n quil ivkwie smovY
lines.transliteration_english: Vati Javaaharu Toleeai Muli N Tuli Vikaai Samovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The jewels are weighed with weights but the latter cannot equate in value with the jewels.

lines.gurmukhi: pQr AMdir AstDwqu pwrsu pris suvMn AlovY
lines.transliteration_english: Padar Andari Asat Dhaatu Paarasu Parasi Suvannu Alovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eight metals (alloys) remain amidst stones but they convert into gold by the touch of philosopher's stone alone.

lines.gurmukhi: pQru Ptk Jlkxw bhu rMgI hoie rMgu n govY
lines.transliteration_english: Padaru Dhatak Jhalakanaa Bahu Rangee Hoi Rangu N Govai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crystal stone shines in many colours but still remains a mere stone.

lines.gurmukhi: pQr vwsu n swau hY mn kTor hoie Awpu ivgovY
lines.transliteration_english: Padar Vaasu N Saau Hai Man Katdoru Hoi Aapu Vigovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Stone has neither fragrance nor taste; the hard-hearted one simply destroys itself.

lines.gurmukhi: kir mUrKweI mUrKu rovY ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Kari Moorakhaaee Moorakhu Rovai ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: The foolish goes on lamenting his own stupidity.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 mUrK dw sMg nw kro

Shabad OS B.translation: Do not keep company with a foolish one

lines.gurmukhi: ijauN mix kwly sp isir swr n jwxY ivsU BirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jioun Mani Kaalay Sap Siri Saar N Jaanai Visoo Bhariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having jewel in its head and knowing it not, the snake remains filled with poison.

lines.gurmukhi: jwxu kQUrI imrg qin JwVwN isM|dw iPrY APirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jaanu Kadooree Mirag Tani Jhaarhaan Sindaa Dhirai Adhariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is known that musk remains in the body of deer, but it goes on smelling it franatically in the bushes.

lines.gurmukhi: ijauN kir moqI isp ivic mrm n jwxY AMdir DirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jioun Kari Motee Sip Vichi Maramu N Jaanai Andari Dhariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The pearl dwells in the shell but the shell does not know the mystery.

lines.gurmukhi: ijauN gweI Qix iccuVI duDu n pIAY lohU jirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jioun Gaaeen Dani Chichurhee Dudhu N Peeai Lohoo Jariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The tick stuck with the teats of cow, takes not its milk but sucks the blood only.

lines.gurmukhi: bgulw qrix n isiKE qIriQ nwie n pQru qirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bagalaa Tarani N Sikhiao Teeradi Nhaai N Padaru Tariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Living in water the crane never learns how to swim and the stone, in spite of its ablutions at various pilgrimage centres cannot swim and go across.

lines.gurmukhi: nwil isAwxy BlI iBK mUrK rwjhu kwju n sirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Naali Siaanay Bhalee Bhikh Moorakh Raajahu Kaaju N Sariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That is why, begging in the company of wise people is better then ruling over a kingdom alongwith Hoots.

lines.gurmukhi: myKI hoie ivgwVY KirAw ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Maykhee Hoi Vigaarhai Khariaa ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: Because he who himself is fake, will also spoil the pure one.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 mUrK nwl Epry rho

Shabad OS B.translation: Be indifferent to the company of fools

lines.gurmukhi: ktxu ctxu kuiqAwN kuqY hlk qY mnu sUgwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Katanu Chatanu Koutiaan Koutai Halak Tai Manu Soogaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The dog, only bites and licks but if it goes mad, one's mind becomes scared of it.

lines.gurmukhi: TMFw qqw koielw kwlw kir kY hQ jlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Tdaddhaa Tataa Koilaa Kaalaa Kari Kai Hadu Jalaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Coal whether cold or hot makes the hand black or burns it.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau ckcUMDr sp dI AMnHw koVHI kir idKlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Chakachoondhar Sap Dee Annhaa Korhhee Kari Dikhalaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mole caught by snake makes it blind or leper.

lines.gurmukhi: jwxu rsaulI dyh ivic vFI pIV rKI srmwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaanu Rasaulee Dayh Vichi Vaddhee Peerh Rakhee Saramaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tumor in the body when operated upon gives pain and if it is kept untouched it is a cause for embarrassment.

lines.gurmukhi: vMis kpUqu kulCxw CifAw bxY n ivic smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Vansi Kapootu Kulachhanaa Chhadai Banai N Vichi Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A wicked son can neither be repudiated nor he can adjust in the family.

lines.gurmukhi: mUrK hyqu n lweIAY prhir vYru Ailpqu vlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakh Haytu N Laaeeai Parahari Vairu Alipatu Valaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Therefore, the stupid should not be loved and while enmity towards him should be avoided, detachment towards him should be maintained.

lines.gurmukhi: duhIN pvwVI duiK ivhwvY ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Duheen Pavaarheen Doukhi Vihaavai ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Otherwise, both the ways, suffering is bound to occur.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 mUrK byQvw qy AOgux gRwhI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The fool is absurd and chooses evils

lines.gurmukhi: ijau hwQI dw nHwvxw bwhir inkil Kyh aufwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Haadee Daa Nhaavanaa Baahari Nikali Khayh Udaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the elephant washes its body and coming out of water, it throws mud over it;

lines.gurmukhi: ijau aUTY dw Kwvxw prhir kxk jvwhw KwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Ootdai Daa Khaavanaa Parahari Kanak Javaahaan Khaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the camel avoiding wheat eats low variety of corn named java-s;

lines.gurmukhi: kmly dw kCotVw kdy lk kdy sIis vlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kamalay Daa Kachhotarhaa Kaday Lak Kaday Seesi Valaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The loin cloth of mad man is sometimes worn by him around his waiste and sometimes on his head;

lines.gurmukhi: ijauN kir tuMfy hQVw so cuqIN so vwiq vqwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jioun Kari Tounday Hadarhaa So Chouteen So Vaati Vataavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The hand of a cripple sometime goes to his buttocks and the same one sometimes to his mouth when yawning;

lines.gurmukhi: sMnHI jwxu luhwr dI iKxu jil ivic iKn Agin smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sannhee Jaanu Luhaar Dee Khinu Jali Vichi Khin Agani Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Blacksmith's pincers are sometimes put in fire and the next moment in water;

lines.gurmukhi: mKI bwxu kubwxu hY lY durgMDu sugMD n BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Makhee Baanu Koubaanu Hai Lai Duragandh Sougandh N Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Evil is the nature of fly, it prefers foul smell to fragrance;

lines.gurmukhi: mUrK dw ikhu hiQ n AwvY ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakh Daa Kihu Hadi N Aavai ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, the fool gets nothing.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 mUrK Awpy Psdy qy kuP`kVI hn

Shabad OS B.translation: Foolish gets himself entrapped and is a liar

lines.gurmukhi: qoqw nlI n CfeI Awpx hQIN PwQw cIkY
lines.transliteration_english: Totaa Nalee N Chhadaee Aapan Hadeen Dhaadaa Cheekai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The parrot does not leave the rod and caught in it cries and wails.

lines.gurmukhi: bwNdru muiT n CfeI Gir Gir ncY JIkxu JIkY
lines.transliteration_english: Baandaru Moutdi N Chhadaee Ghari Ghari Nachai Jheekanu Jheekai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Monkey too does not leave the handful of corn (in the pitcher) and suffers dancing and gritting its teeth from door to door.

lines.gurmukhi: gdhu AVI n CfeI cIGI paudI hIkix hIkY
lines.transliteration_english: Gadahu Arhee N Chhadaee Reeghee Paudee Heekani Heekai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The donkey also when beaten, kicks and brays loudly but does not shed its stubbornness.

lines.gurmukhi: kuqy ckI ctxI pUC n isDI DRIkix DRIkY
lines.transliteration_english: Koutay Chakee N Chatanee Poochh N Sidhee Dhreekani Dhreekai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The dog does not leave licking the flour mill and its tail though pulled, never turns straight.

lines.gurmukhi: krin kuPkV mUrKwN sp gey PiV Pwtin lIkY
lines.transliteration_english: Karani Kudhakarh Moorakhaan Sap Gaay Dharhi Dhaatani Leekai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The foolish ones boast foolishly and beat the track while the snake has gone away.

lines.gurmukhi: pg lhwie gxwie srIkY ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Pag Lahaai Ganaai Sareekai ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Even when humiliated by their turbans taken off their heads, they count themselves superior to their collaterals.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 mUrK s`c dw Xwr nhIN

Shabad OS B.translation: Stupid is not friendly to truth

lines.gurmukhi: AMnHw AwKy liV mrY KusI hovY suix nwau sujwKw
lines.transliteration_english: Annhaa Aakhay Larhi Marai Khousee Hovai Souni Naau Sujaakhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The blind stupid one fights to the finish if he is called blind (intellectually) and feels flattered if called eyed (a wise one).

lines.gurmukhi: Bolw AwKy Blw mMin Ahmku jwix Ajwix n BwKw
lines.transliteration_english: Bholaa Aakhay Bhalaa Manni Ahamaku Jaani Ajaani N Bhaakhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Calling him simple minded makes him feel good but he would not talk to one who tells him that he is a silly person.

lines.gurmukhi: DorI AwKY his dy bld vKwix krY min mwKw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhoreen Aakhai Hasi Day Balad Vakhaani Karai Mani Maakhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He smiles at being called a carrier of the burden (of all) but feels angry when told that he is just an ox.

lines.gurmukhi: kwauN isAwxp jwxdw ivstw Kwie n BwK suBwKw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaaoun Siaanap Jaanadaa Visataa Khaai N Bhaakh Soubhaakhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The crow knows many skills but it crows jarringly and eats faeces.

lines.gurmukhi: nwau surIq kurIq dw musk iblweI gwNfI swKw
lines.transliteration_english: Naau Sureet Kureet Daa Mousak Bilaaee Gaandee Saakhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: To the bad customs the stupid refers as good conduct and calls the indurated faeces of cat, fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: hyiT KVw QU QU krY igdV hiQ n AwvY dwKw
lines.transliteration_english: Haytdi Kharhaa Doo Doo Karai Gidarh Hadi N Aavai Daakhaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the jackal unable to reach and eat grapes on tree, spits over them, so is the case of a fool.

lines.gurmukhi: bolivgwVu mUrKu ByfwKw ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Bolavigaarhu Moorakhu Bhaydaakhaa ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: The foolish person is a blind follower like sheep and his obdurate talk spoils his relationship with every one.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 mUrK ivx gux gurbI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Devoid of virtues, the stupid is arrogant

lines.gurmukhi: ruKwN ivic kuruKu hY ArMfu A\\\\weI Awpu gxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Roukhaan Vichi Kuroukhu Hai Arandu Avaaee Aapu Ganaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The worst possible among the trees is castor tree which undesrvedly makes itself noticed.

lines.gurmukhi: ipdw ijau pMKyrUAwN bih bih fwlI bhuqu bPwey
lines.transliteration_english: Pidaa Jiu Pankhayrooaan Bahi Bahi Daalee Bahoutu Badhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Pidd jiu, a very small among the birds goes an jumping from one branch to another and feels much inflated.

lines.gurmukhi: Byf iBivMgw muhu krY qrxwpY idih cwir vlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhayd Bhivingaa Muhu Karai Taranaapai Dihi Chaari Valaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sheep, too, during its brief... youth bleats loudly (proudly).

lines.gurmukhi: muhu AKI nku kn ijauN ieMdRIAwN ivic gwNif sdwey
lines.transliteration_english: Muhu Akhee Naku Kan Jioun Indreeaan Vichi Gaandi Sadaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Anus also feels proud of being called one of the organs like eye, ear, nose and mouth.

lines.gurmukhi: mIAw Grhu inkwlIAY qrksu drvwjy tMgvwey
lines.transliteration_english: Meeaa Gharahu Nikaaleeai Tarakasu Daravaajay Tangavaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The husband even while kicked out of home by wife hangs his quiver at the door (to show his masculinity).

lines.gurmukhi: mUrK AMdir mwxswN ivxu gux grbu krY Awlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakh Andari Maanasaan Vinu Goun Garabu Karai Aakhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly among the human beings, the stupid one devoid of all virtues feels proud of himself and persistently tries to get noticed.

lines.gurmukhi: mjls bYTw Awpu lKwey ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Majalas Baitdaa Aapu Lakhaaay ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: In an assembly, he beholds only his ownself (and not the wisdom of others).

lines.gurmukhi: 14 mUrK kOx hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Who is a fool?   ?

lines.gurmukhi: mUrK iqs no AwKIAY bolu n smJY boil n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakh Tis No Aakheeai Bolu N Samajhai Boli N Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Foolish is he who neither understands the matter in hand nor speaks well.

lines.gurmukhi: horo ikhu kir puCIAY horo ikau kir AwiK vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Horo Kihu Kari Pouchheeai Horo Kihu Kari Aakhi Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is asked something else and he replies altogether about something different.

lines.gurmukhi: isK dyie smJweIAY ArQu AnrQu mnY ivic AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sikh Dayi Samajhaaeeai Aradu Anaradu Manai Vichi Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ill advised, he misinterprets it and brings forth from his mind the contrary meaning.

lines.gurmukhi: vfw AsmJu n smJeI suriq ivhUxw hoie hYrwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Vadaa Asamajhu N Samajhaee Surati Vihoonaa Hoi Hairaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is a big idiot who does not understand and being devoid of consciousness is ever surprised and confused.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq iciq n AwveI durmiq imqRu sqRu prvwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Chiti N Aanaee Duramati Mitr Satr Paravaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He never cherishes in his heart the wisdom of the Gum and due to his evil intellect considers his friend as a foe.

lines.gurmukhi: AgnI sphuN vrjIAY gux ivic Avgux krY iD|wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Aganee Sapahoun Varajeeai Goun Vichi Avagoun Karai Dhiaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The wisdom of not going near snake and fire he takes otherwise and forcibly turns virtue into vice.

lines.gurmukhi: mUqy rovY mwN n is\\\\wxY ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Mootai Rovai Maa N Siaanai ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: He behaves like an infant who does not recognise his mother and goes on crying and pissing.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 mUrK dI pCwx

Shabad OS B.translation: Identification of a fool

lines.gurmukhi: rwhu Cif auJiV pvY AwgU no Bulw kir jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Raahu Chhadi Ujharhi Pavai Aagoo No Bhulaa Kari Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who leaving the path away follows a trackless waste and considers his leader gone astray, is a fool.

lines.gurmukhi: byVy ivic bhwlIAY kuid pvY ivic vhx iD|wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Bayrhay Vichi Bahaaleeai Kudi Pavai Vichi Vahan Dhiaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seated in the boat he jumps impulsively into the current.

lines.gurmukhi: suGVwN ivic bihiTAwN boilivgwiV auGwiV vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sougharhaan Vichi Bahitdiaan Bolivigaarhi Oughaarhi Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sitting among the noble ones he, due to his ill talk stands exposed.

lines.gurmukhi: suGVwN mUrK jwxdw Awip suGVu hoie ivrqIhwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sougharhaan Moorakh Jaanadaa Aapi Sougharhu Hoi Virateehaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The wise he considers stupid and hids his own conduct as a clever one.

lines.gurmukhi: idh no rwiq vKwxdw cwmciVk ijvyN twnwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Dih No Raati Vakhaanadaa Chaamacharhik Jivayn Taanaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like , a bat and a glow worm he describes the day as night.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq mUrKu iciq n AwxY ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Moorakhu Chiti N Aanai ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: The wisdom of Gum never resides in the heart of a foolish person.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 mUrK dw AMq

Shabad OS B.translation: The end of a fool

lines.gurmukhi: vYid cMgyrI auTxI lY isl vtw kcrw BMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaidi Changayree Ootdanee Lai Sil Vataa Kacharaa Bhannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A physician in order to cure a female camel, of a melon stuck in its throat, crushed the melon in its throat by hitting out side the neck with his pestle and mortar.

lines.gurmukhi: syvik isKI vYdgI mwrI buFI rovin rMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Sayvaki Sikhee Vaidagee Maaree Buddhee Rovani Rannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His servant (who was watching) thought he had mastered the art and killed an old ill woman by the same process, causing general lamentation among women.

lines.gurmukhi: pkiV clwieAw rwvlY paudI auGiV gey su kMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Pakarhi Chalaaiaa Raavalai Paudee Ougharhi Gaay Su Kannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The people seized the pretending physician and produced him before the king who ordered for him a thorough beating, upon which he came to his senses.

lines.gurmukhi: puCY AwiK vKwixaunu auGiV gieAw pwju prCMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Pouchhai Aakhi Vakhaaniounu Ougharhi Gaiaa Paaju Parachhannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When questioned he confessed the whole circumstance and his imposture was thus exposed.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrKUAw cuix kiFAw ijau kckVw n rlY rqMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Paarakhooaa Chouni Kaddhiaa Jiu Kachakarhaa N Ralai Ratannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The wise men threw him out as a piece of glass cannot rank with jewels.

lines.gurmukhi: mUrKu AklI bwhrw vwNshu mUil n hovI gMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakhu Akalee Baaharaa Vaansahu Mooli N Hovee Gannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A fool has no sense as a bamboo could never equal sugar-cane.

lines.gurmukhi: mwxs dyhI psU aupMnw ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Maanas Dayhee Pasoo Oupannaa ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: He in fact, is an animal born in the form of a man.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 mUrK rIs dw Pl Bogdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The foolish undergoes the results of imitation

lines.gurmukhi: mhwdyv dI syv kir vru pwieAw swhY dy puqY
lines.transliteration_english: Mahaadayv Dee Sayv Kari Varu Paaiaa Saahai Day Poutai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The son of a banker served Mahadev and got a boon (of attaining wealth).

lines.gurmukhi: drbu srUp sryvVY Awie vVy Gir AMdir auqY
lines.transliteration_english: Darabu Saroop Sarayvarhai Aaay Varhay Ghari Andari Outai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wealth came to his house in the guise of sadhus of gramanic tradition.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau hiQAwrI mwrIAin iqau iqau drb hoih DV DuqY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Hadiaaree Maareeani Tiu Tiu Darab Hoi Dharhadhoutai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As they were beaten, heaps of money emerged there in his house.

lines.gurmukhi: buqI krdy ifiTEnu nweI cYnu n bYTy suqY
lines.transliteration_english: Boutee Karaday Ditdiaonu Naaee Chainu N Baitday Soutai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A barber working in the house also saw this scene and he becoming restive lost his sleep.

lines.gurmukhi: mwry Awix sryvVy suix dIbwix mswix ACuqY
lines.transliteration_english: Maaray Aani Sarayvarhay Souni Deebaani Masaani Achhoutai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Availing an opportunity he killed all the sadhus and the matter of the innocent victims came to the court of law.

lines.gurmukhi: mQY vwil pCwiVAw vwl Cfwien iks dY buqY
lines.transliteration_english: Madai Vaali Pachhaarhiaa Vaal Chhadaaiani Kis Dai Boutai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Catching hold from his hair he was thrashed. Now by what power he will give rescued from that clutch.

lines.gurmukhi: mUrKu bIjY bIau kurqY ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakhu Beejai Beeu Kuroutai ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: The foolish sows seeds out of season (and suffers loss).

lines.gurmukhi: 18 pMfq vI mUrK ho skdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Even a pandit could be a fool

lines.gurmukhi: gosit gwNgy qylIAY pMifq nwil hovY jgu dyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gosati Gaangay Tayleeai Pandit Naali Hovai Jagu Daykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A discussion between Gangu, the oilman and a pandit was being witnessed by one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: KVI krY iek AMgulI gwNgw duie vyKwlY ryKY
lines.transliteration_english: Kharhee Karai Ik Angulee Gaangaa Dui Vaykhaalai Raykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Showing one finger to Gang/ the pandit indicated that the Lord is one. But Gangu thought that he wanted to extract his (Ganges) one eye and hence he showed two fingers indicating that he will bring out both of his (pandit's) eyes.

lines.gurmukhi: Pyir aucwie pMjwNgulw gwNgw muiT hlwie AlyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhayri Ouchaai Panjaangulaa Gaangaa Moutdi Halaai Alaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the pandit thought that Gangu is hinting at the two dimensions of Lord - nirgun (beyond all virtues) and sagun, (with all virtues).

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY auiT cilAw pMifqu hwir BulwvY ByKY
lines.transliteration_english: Paireen Pai Outdi Chaliaa Panditu Haari Bhulaavai Bhaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Pandit now raised five fingers to show that His two forms are due to the five elements, but, considering the pandit as indicating that with five fingers he would scratch the face of Gangu,

lines.gurmukhi: inrguxu srguxu AMg duie prmysru pMij imlin sryKY
lines.transliteration_english: Niragounu Saragounu Ang Dui Paramaysaru Panji Milani Saraykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gangs brandished his fist showing that he would kill him by the stroke of his fist. Now pandit felt that he was being made to understand that unity of five elements was the cause of the creation.

lines.gurmukhi: AKI dovyN BMnswN mukI lwie hlwie inmyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Akheen Dovain Bhannasaan Moukee Laai Halaai Nimaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mistakingly the pandit accepted his defeat and fell at his opponent's feet and left the place. In fact the fool had meant that he would bring out his eyes and attack with a tight fist but this was interpreted differently by the pandit.

lines.gurmukhi: mUrK pMifqu suriq ivsyKY ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakh Panditu Surati Visaykhai ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus because of his specific thinking even the pandit was also proved a fool.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 mUrK dI sMgq dw Pl

Shabad OS B.translation: The result of association with the stupid one

lines.gurmukhi: TMFy KUhhuM nHwie kY pg ivswir AwieAw isir nMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Tdaddhay Khoohahoun Nhaai Kai Pag Visaari Aaiaa Siri Nagai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having taken bath on the well, a person forgot his turban and returned home bare headed.

lines.gurmukhi: Gr ivic rMnw kmlIAwN DusI lIqI dyiK kuFMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghar Vichi Rannaan Kamaleeaan Dhousee Leetee Daykhi Kuddhangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing his improper conduct (of being bare headed) the silly women started weeping and wailing (Seeing turbanless master of the house they conjectured the death of some one in the family).

lines.gurmukhi: rMnw dyiK iptMdIAw FwhwN mwrYN hoie insMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Rannaan Daykhi Pitandeeaan Ddhaahaan Maarain Hoi Nisangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing the weeping women, others too, began mourning. People gethered and sitting in lines started condoling with the family.

lines.gurmukhi: lok isAwpy AwieAw rMnw purs juVy lY pMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Lok Siaapay Aaiaa Rannaan Puras Jurhay Lai Pangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now the barber woman who leads the mourning on occasions asked as to who is to be wept and whose dirge she should lead, i.e. what is the name of the dead.

lines.gurmukhi: nwiex puCdI iptdIAwN iks dY nwie AlHwxI AMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Naain Pouchhadee Pitadeeaan Kis Dai Naai Alhaanee Angai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The daughter-in-law of family hinted towards father-in-law to elicit answer of this question (because he was found bare headed.

lines.gurmukhi: shury puCh jwie kY kaux muAw nUh auqru mMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Sahuray Pouchhahu Jaai Kai Kaoun Muaa Nooh Outaru Mangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then the fact was disclosed by him that he just forgot to wear turban).

lines.gurmukhi: kwvwN rOlw mUrKu sMgY ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Kaavaan Raulaa Moorakhu Sangai ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the assembly of the fools such cawing takes place (because crows also listening to one voice start cawing jointly).

lines.gurmukhi: 20 mUrK nwl ik`kur vrqIey

Shabad OS B.translation: How to deal with a fool

lines.gurmukhi: jy mUrKu smJweIAY smJY nwhI Cwv n Dupw
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Moorakhu Samajhaaeeai Samajhai Naahee Chhaanv N Dhoupaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even if told about the shade and the sunshine, the fool does not understand it.

lines.gurmukhi: AKIN priK n jwxeI ipql suienw kYhwN rupw
lines.transliteration_english: Akheen Parakhi N Jaanaee Pital Suinaa Kaihaan Roupaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: With his eyes he cannot distinguish between brass and bronze or gold and silver.

lines.gurmukhi: swau n jwxY qyl iGA DirAw koil GVolw kupw
lines.transliteration_english: Saau N Jaanai Tayl Ghia Dhariaa Koli Gharholaa Koupaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He can not know the difference of taste between the pot of ghee and an oil vessel.

lines.gurmukhi: suriq ivhUxw rwiq idhu cwnxu quil AnHyrw Gupw
lines.transliteration_english: Surati Vihoonaa Raati Dihu Chaananu Tuli Anhayraa Ghoupaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Day and night he is devoid of consciousness and to him light and darkness are the same.

lines.gurmukhi: vwsu kQUrI Qom dI imhr kulI ADauVI qupw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaasu Kadooree Dom Dee Mihar Kulee Adhaurhee Toupaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fragrance of musk and odour of garlic or stiching of velvet and hide are the same for him.

lines.gurmukhi: vYrI imqR n smJeI rMgu surMg kurMgu ACupw
lines.transliteration_english: Vairee Mitr N Samajhaee Rangu Surang Kurangu Achhoupaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He does not identify a friend and an enemy and remains completely unconcerned towards the bad or good colour (of life).

lines.gurmukhi: mUrK nwil cMgyrI cupw ]20]32]
lines.transliteration_english: Moorakh Naali Changayree Choupaa ?20?32?bateeha?

Shabad OS B.translation: Silence is the best in the company of fool.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: duibDw invwir Abrn huie brn ibKY pwNc prpMc n drs Adrs hY
lines.transliteration_english: Doubidhaa Nivaari Abaran Hui Baran Bikhai , Paanch Parapanch N Daras Adaras Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By perpetual meditation on Lord's name, a Guru-conscious person distances himself from duality and caste discrimination. He frees himself from the grip of five vices (lust, anger, greed, ego and attachment) nor does he entangle himself in the rationales o

lines.gurmukhi: prm pwrs gur pris pwrs Bey kink Aink Dwqu Awpw Aprs hY
lines.transliteration_english: Param Paaras Gur Parasi Paaras Bhaay , Kanik Anik Dhaatu Aapaa Aparas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an iron piece when touched with a philosopher-stone becomes gold, similarly a devotee meeting Guru becomes a pious and a clean man.

lines.gurmukhi: nv duAwr duAwr pwirbRmwsn isMGwsn mY inJr Jrin rucq n An rs hY
lines.transliteration_english: Nav Duaar Duaar Paaribramaasan Singhaasan Mai , Nijhar Jharani Rouchat N An Ras Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Overcoming the pleasures of the nine doors of the body, he rests his faculties in the tenth door, where the divine elixir flows perpetually that turn him away from all other pleasures.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK sMiD imly bIs iekIs eIs Anhd gd gd ABr Brs hY ]32]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Bees Ikees Eesa , Anahad Gad Gad Abhar Bharas Hai ?32?

Shabad OS B.translation: Be assured that the meeting of Guru and a disciple, makes a disciple realise Lord and virtually becomes like Him. His  heart then remains immersed in the celestial music. (32)
